How Many People Out There Own Virtual Pets?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Town Hall (Polls): Polls on Other Subjects: How Many People Out There Own Virtual Pets?
By Lisa Shock on Saturday, June 17, 2000 - 12:12 pm:

Just curious to see if anyone out there also owned any virtual pets like tamagatchi, furby, or the computer sort like fin-fin...

By Kurasu Soratobu on Saturday, June 17, 2000 - 02:16 pm:

Two out of three. I do have a Furby (though it needs some repairwork or replacement, after getting moist). I also own a Tamagochi, though it's long since disappeared somewhere into the house. One day, I'll find it again!

I also have Pocketstation, and some of the games that it plays (or sub-games, as the case may be) are very virtual pet-like.

By Lisa Shock on Saturday, June 17, 2000 - 03:48 pm:

I've got a Poo-Chi right now, but it's pretty disappointing. I adopted an abused Furby for a few months, but gave it to a needy household. I am interested in getting one of the Yoda Interactives that's supposed to be shipping in July. The Gamestop has a description; it looks like it's a lot more 'interactive' than some pets. On the PC side of things, I've seen Fin'Fin, Creatures and the Catz/Dogz/Oddballz series. Perhaps the weirdest there was one (from the creators of Catz) called Babyz. Lots of little babies running around, very strange, I played it at a trade show last year.

By ShadowFusion on Wednesday, May 22, 2002 - 02:02 pm:

I didn't notice this thread until now...and i can't help but laugh when i think of those tamagachi things. Mainly because my sister has/had literally like 30 of the things, and none of them work. When she got tired of one she would go out and get another, simply abandoning her previous one.

As for me, i had one like 5 years ago, but i found it boring, and i hated the noise it made. I gave it to my sister, and it undoubtedly is abandoned under a pile of clothes in her room.

Perhaps there should be electronic tamagachi shelters for stray and abandoned electronic pets...

By Hare Raiser on Thursday, May 23, 2002 - 04:40 am:

I used to collect keychain pets. That's kind of how I got into MR. I don't really play with them anymore, but recently I found that my pet rabbits had gotten into my old collection and eaten all the buttons off them. (That's something rabbits do -- they like rubber buttons, like the kinds on remote controls -- who knows why?) I'm pretty bummed out about that. I had a Digimon (my husband did too), a Nano Bunny, several varieties of Tamagotchi, a Giga Pound (it's got several different dogs in it), and a bunch of weird cheap import stuff that appeared all over the stores when the fad was at its peak. It's all fun and colorful. I used to go buy a new one every couple weeks. :)
